column4: how do I find what version of java is installed on my ubuntu system?
ls -l $(type -path -all java) shows 2 java files - How do I find out which version of JAVA is installed?
ls -l $(type -path -all java) shows 2 java files - How do I find out which version of JAVA is installed?
java version "1.6.0_20"
ls -l $(type -path -all java) shows 2 java files >> which are
/usr/bin/java -> /etc/alternatives/java
/usr/lib/jvm/java-6-sun/bin/java -> ../jre/bin/java
you having an issue with elluminate or something that calls on java-6 jvm?
.. so there is an issue with my java installation ..right?
.. how do I fix the problem?
i had a similiar issue if not the same
any idea how I could solve the issue?
same goes for anything, you have to have the right /usr/bin/program-bin pointed to in browser settings, like i use evince to ALWAYS open up my pdf's, i set that in apps in options of FF
understand?
its not browser. I am working with Eclipse and seems like my build is getting messed up because of JAVA compiler mismatch
and so I dont want 2 different versions running on my ubuntu system
what is eclipse? what does it do
remove them both and install one. start from scratch
eclipse is a programming ide
sounds more advanced, i would have to much with it to get it to work by my own hand lol
ok .. shd try removing both java versions then
also, dont confuse plugins with programs, as this is confusing
i would
thanks
